content:
Closest Pair Data Structures: Talks

  • Dynamic algorithms for half-space reporting, proximity problems, and geometric minimum spanning trees, 33rd IEEE Symp. Foundations of Computer Science, Pittsburgh, October 25, 1992. I don't remember for sure, but I think Pankaj Agarwal presented this talk.
  • Subquadratic algorithms for the straight skeleton, Jeff Erickson, January 24, 1997.
  • Raising roofs, crashing cycles, and playing pool, Jeff Erickson, Dagstuhl Computational Geometry Seminar, February, 1997.
  • Raising roofs, crashing cycles, and playing pool: applications of a data structure for finding pairwise interactions, ICS Research Symposium, Dept. of Information & Computer Science, UC Irvine, February 7, 1997.
  • A subquadratic algorithm for the straight skeleton, Workshop on Voronoi Diagrams, Triangulations, and Splines, Tempe, Arizona, February 21, 1997.
  • Raising roofs, crashing cycles, and playing pool, Jeff Erickson, Johns Hopkins Univ., April, 1997.
  • Raising roofs, crashing cycles, and playing pool, Jeff Erickson, Univ. of Maryland, College Park, April, 1997.
  • Fast hierarchical clustering via dynamic closest pairs, Applied Statistics Seminar Series on Cluster Analysis, Center for Statistical Clustering, UC Irvine, May 7, 1997.
  • Fast hierarchical clustering and other applications of dynamic closest pairs, Worksh. Effiziente Algorithmen, Oberwolfach, Germany, August 7, 1997.
  • Raising roofs, crashing cycles, and playing pool, Jeff Erickson, 29th Computational Geometry Day, NYU, December 12, 1997.
  • Fast hierarchical clustering and other applications of dynamic closest pairs, 9th ACM-SIAM Symp. Discrete Algorithms, San Francisco, January 1998.
  • Raising roofs, crashing cycles, and playing pool: applications of a data structure for finding pairwise interactions, Jeff Erickson, 12th ACM Symp. Comp. Geom., Minneapolis, June 1998.
  • Incremental and decremental maintenance of planar width, 10th ACM-SIAM Symp. Discrete Algorithms, Baltimore, January 1999.
David Eppstein, Information & Computer Science, UC Irvine, .
